name: Quality Inn Downtown Inner Harbour

reviews.title: Thoroughly pleasant, and a bargain to boot
reviews.text: This is a pleasant property, a little older but entirely serviceable, in a good location that's not right in the middle of things but still easily within walking distance of the Inner Harbour and the major downtown attractions. We had a quiet room on the third floor that overlooked the inner courtyard; in previous stays, my companion has had rooms on the outside overlooking Blanshard and Courtenay streets, which are somewhat subject to traffic noise and noise from passers-by. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Like many older properties, soundproofing from the hall wasn't great - we heard footfalls and conversation quite clearly - but luckily the other residents were relatively quiet throughout our stay. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Nice Room for the $$$
reviews.text: My husband, son and I were in town for the annual dragonboat festival the weekend of 8/17/12-8/19/12. We were able to reserve a room several months in advance, for much less than the hotel the festival recommended. The room was nice enough, with a flat panel tv and a mini refrigerator. Plenty of lamps and even complimentary bathrobes for our stay. One downside, no A/C, though they did provide a table-top fan, which we needed the first night as it was pretty warm. The hotel was easy walking distance to the harbor, shops and restaurants. Great courtyard with fountain, deck and tables provided a perfect meeting place for other people we were traveling with. The breakfast at the Argyle Attic (attached restaurant/bar) was nice and in line price-wise with other comparable restaurants nearby. Some road noise and shouting from people out and about on Friday evening, but not too bad. Overall, I would stay here again!

reviews.title: A great little hotel plus service with a smile
reviews.text: Although this is a small hotel we found it to be really suitable for what we needed. It has a great location within walking distance of harbour, attractions and shops. Our room obviously wasn't newly decorated but it had everything we needed including a fridge and a large flat-screen tv. Particularly liked the alarm clock/iphone dock - very useful for charging the phone each evening! We used the laundry, pool and "fitness" room all of which were just what we needed, nothing more nothing less. We also used the restaurant - The Argyle Attic - which provided a good value range of breakfasts and very good service. Most of all it was the great service we enjoyed - thanks to the helpfulness of the service from all the staff (Samantha, Donna and Glenn and Gary - I remembered guys!). Yes, there is only one lift, but it is not a huge hotel and I can see this is a something which is not easy to change. We had a great stay and I would definitely recommend this and stay again. This was probably the nicest hotel we stayed in during our 3 week holiday in Canada which included staying in 5 hotels.

reviews.title: Great location to see Victoria and nearby area
reviews.text: Great comfy beds. Lots of space in the rooms. Big telly was great to catch some of the Olympics. Loved the convenience of the microwave and frig. Would recommend to friends and family....And the steam room was wonderful for getting the aches out after a long trip.

reviews.title: A place where the staff is listening!
reviews.text: My trips to Victoria are of a medical reason. It is no fun to pay high summer rates when the visit to Victoria is not as a tourist. Over the years I have tried many different Hotels in Victoria and what i have noticed that at the Quality In the staff really listens and accommodate anything they can do to make the stay better. Laura the front manager is excellent.
This hotel is located in the heart of downtown, within walking distance of everything, but the best part is the intelligent, friendly staff, from house cleaning to the front desk.
reviews.title: Great Location, Delightful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though it is located downtown, the hotel was quiet and "homey". The rooms are not opulent or particularly spacious, but if you are looking to explore the city instead of sitting in your hotel room, you won't find a better bargain than this hotel in downtown Victoria.
reviews.title: Thank you for a WONDERFUL stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was serene and comfortable. I especially enjoyed our quiet view onto the brick-paved courtyard filled with flower baskets and a pretty little fountain. This convenient and well-appointed hotel gave these two road-weary travelers a place to call 'home' for a weekend while we explored Victoria and the island.
reviews.title: GREAT EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: We just recently stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. The room was beautiful. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was a delight every morning with Donna as our waitress. The meal was worth the price and her enthusiasm and suggestions for the day was infectious. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good value and location - property shows its age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently rode into town on bicycle from Sidney and arrived soaking wet from the rain, wanting a room before the regular check-in time. The staff were very courteous and got us into one of our two rooms quite quickly (so that we could take showers and get into dry clothes). Our second room came shortly thereafter and they really made an effort to get us into these rooms even though we had arrived early.
reviews.title: Great location and Great Staff

reviews.text: Can't fault the hotel itself; comfortable, friendly, good position. The kitchenette was well equipped and spotless.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reason I couldn't give an "excellent" rating instead of "very good" was because the restaurant was terrible. My food was almost inedible- poor quality, dry, tasteless,obviousy microwaved and, for what it was, expensive. Also, the chairs could do with a few cushions!
reviews.title: vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi Laura, we had a wonderful time in Victoria . we were very happy that we were able to have the room we requested (had that room a few years ago.) I appreciate the effort you made and we will be back .We usually don't travel much because of work schedules. But, when we retire next year we will try and stay at a Quality Inn Hotel. The location of the Hotel was close to the places we could walk. Used car once in a while.
reviews.title: Sweet suite surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was good sized we had a King bed and the many windows in the room really was nice.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you.
reviews.title: Great Night, Great Hotel, Excellent Coffee

reviews.text: Our one-night stay was great - the beds were very comfortable and the room was fairly clean, and quiet in which to fall asleep. The person upstairs woke up very early though which woke up someone in our party at 5:30 a.m. - walking back and forth, lots of floor creaking. Perhaps repair above 221 would put things right! Staff were welcoming and helpful. Underground parking. Good hearty breakfast. Great price for downtown Victoria.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Pleasant

reviews.text: I usually stay at the Regent, but was booking last minute, and could not get in there. After some online searching, I found this hotel, looked decent online, and went with it. I had never stayed at a Quality before, so I did not know what to expect. I was quite pleasantly surprised, a decent sized, nice clean room with flat screen TV, great location, and reasonably priced, as well. You can tell it's quite an old building (especially the elevator!) that has been spruced up, but a decent place to stay. The only downside was I looked to go for breakfast at the restaurant around the corner, as I received a half off coupon, and it wasn't open at 7, as stated. But, there is no shortage of places to go, and that's not the fault of the hotel. Oh, can't forget, very friendly and helpful staff, too!
reviews.title: Solid Choice for a downtown stay

reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights with my wife and 10 month old son. We had a great overall experience. The location is fantastic - very walkable to the harbor and many restaurants and activities. The staff was friendly and helpful - there was some confusion about hotel parking and we received a parking ticket - they took care of it without any trouble. The room layout is great - my son could sleep in his pack and play in the other room while my wife and I were able to spend time in the main room without disturbing him. The kitchenette was fully stocked - unfortunately the coffee maker was the single brew pod type which didn't work with the coffee we brought, but not a big deal - the coffee in the lobby was good.
reviews.title: Great location overall, minus a few cleaning issues ...

reviews.text: One fairly significant issue was the cleanliness of the room and especially the dishes. When we arrived the table in the main room was dirty - it had leftover crumbs on it. One of the stir sticks in the coffee area had a SpongeBob Squarepants paper cutout stuck through it, likely from the previous occupants. The dishes stacked in the cabinet were actually wet, and one glass had lipstick on the edge. We washed all dishes we used ourselves. The rest of the room was clean so this could be corrected fairly easily.
reviews.title: Great Location! Great Price!

reviews.text: We'd certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Great gym, room

aka: Quality Inn Downtown Inner Harbour Hotel
description: Three-story Hotel with Brown & green trim; located downtown victoria two blocks from Inner Harbour, tourist attractions, shopping, dining & theatres
